name: Kindle Highlights
description: Automated sync of Kindle highlights using Linux bash scripts.
body_html:
Kindle Highlights

This project automates the syncing of my Kindle highlights using Linux bash scripts. The workflow extracts, cleans, and organizes all highlights into a structured format.

It helped me learn:

  • How to work efficiently in Linux
  • Shell scripting fundamentals
  • Automating repetitive tasks

name: Cloud Resume Challenge
description: Building a serverless resume site on AWS â€” this very project!
body_html:
Cloud Resume Challenge

This project is my implementation of the Cloud Resume Challenge, a serverless resume website built entirely on AWS. It includes a static frontend, API, database, and CI/CD pipeline.

Through this project I practiced:

  • Serverless architecture
  • Working with AWS services
  • Automating deployments and infrastructure

name: Start with IT
description: 15 October 2024, I started my first lesson about IT. This was a Google IT Support course. It took me 4 month to finish it. I get familiar with basic concepts of networking, hardware, and security.
body_html:
Start With IT

I began my IT journey on 15 October 2024. I started with the Google IT Support course, which introduced me to:

  • Networking fundamentals
  • Hardware basics
  • Security concepts

It took me 4 months to finish, and it built the foundation for everything I'm doing now.
